verses.text: 照樣，你們作妻子的，要順服自己的丈夫，好使不信道的丈夫受到感動，不是因著你們的言語，而是因著你們的生活，

words.note: Often used in religious context of submission.
Lit. 'not believing the Way/truth'.

verses.text: 因為他們看見了你們敬畏和純潔的生活。

words.note: Often implies a respectful fear of divine power.
Used in moral and spiritual contexts.

verses.text: 不要單注重外表的裝飾，就如鬈頭髮、戴金飾、穿華麗衣服；
卻要在裡面存著溫柔安靜的心靈，作不能毀壞的裝飾，這在 神面前是極寶貴的。

words.note: Often refers to one's spiritual or emotional core.
The elevated space indicates reverence.
Literally 'face front'.

verses.text: 因為古時仰望 神的聖潔婦女，正是這樣裝飾自己，順服丈夫，

words.note: Often used for looking up to God or a higher power.
The elevated space indicates reverence.
Pertains to divine holiness or moral purity.
Often used in religious context of submission.

verses.text: 像撒拉聽從亞伯拉罕，稱他為主一樣；你們若行善，不怕任何恐嚇，就是撒拉的女兒了。
照樣，你們作丈夫的，也要合情合理的與妻子同住。要體諒她比你軟弱，要尊敬她，因為她是和你一同承受生命的恩典的。這樣，就使你們的禱告不受攔阻。

words.note: Lit. 'fitting emotion and fitting reason'.
Often refers to divine grace in Christianity.

verses.text: 總括來說，你們要彼此同心，互相體恤，親愛像弟兄，滿有溫柔，存心謙卑。

words.note: Often used to refer to fellow believers in the Bible.

verses.heading: Suffering for Doing Good

verses.text: 不要以惡報惡，以辱罵還辱罵，倒要祝福，因為你們就是為此蒙召，好叫你們承受福氣。

words.note: A common biblical idiom.
Refers to being called by God.

verses.text: 因為「凡希望享受人生，要看見好日子的，就要禁止舌頭不出惡言，嘴唇不說詭詐的話；
也要離惡行善，尋找並追求和睦。
因為主的眼睛看顧義人，他的耳朵垂聽他們的呼求；但主的臉敵對作惡的人。」

words.note: Refers to a person who is righteous in God's eyes.
Implies a higher power bending down to listen.

verses.text: 如果你們熱心行善，有誰能害你們呢？

words.note: Lit. 'hot-hearted'.

verses.text: 就算你們要為義受苦，也是有福的。「不要怕人的恐嚇，也不要畏懼。」
只要心裡尊基督為聖，以他為主；常常作好準備，去回答那些問你們為甚麼懷有盼望的人，

words.note: A verb-object phrase meaning 'make good preparation'.

verses.text: 但要用溫柔敬畏的心回答。當存無愧的良心，使那些誣賴你們這在基督裡有好品行的人，在毀謗你們的事上蒙羞。

words.note: Forms '在...事上' meaning 'in the matter of'.

verses.text: 如果 神的旨意是要你們受苦，那麼為行善受苦，總比為行惡受苦好。

words.note: The leading space is a traditional sign of reverence for God.
Refers to God's will or decree in religious contexts.

verses.text: 因為基督也曾一次為你們的罪死了，就是義的代替不義的，為要領你們到 神面前。就肉體的方面說，他曾死去；就靈的方面說，他復活了；

words.note: Here '的' turns the adjective '義' into a noun 'the righteous one'.
Here '的' turns the adjective '不義' into a noun 'the unrighteous ones'.
Indicates purpose or goal.
The leading space is a traditional sign of reverence for God.
Introduces a particular aspect or point of view.
Often refers to human nature or physical body in a religious context.
Introduces a particular aspect or point of view.

verses.text: 他藉這靈也曾去向那些在監管中的靈宣講，

words.note: Often forms '在...中' (in the midst of, among).

verses.text: 他們就是挪亞建造方舟的日子、 神容忍等待的時候，那些不順從的人。當時進入方舟、藉著水得救的人不多，只有八個。

words.note: The leading space is a traditional sign of reverence for God.

verses.text: 這水預表的洗禮，現在也拯救你們：不是除去肉體的污穢，而是藉著耶穌基督的復活，向 神許願常存純潔的良心。

words.note: Refers to something that foreshadows a future event.
A formal term often used in religious contexts for spiritual salvation.
Often refers to the human physical nature, sometimes with spiritual connotation.
Often used for moral or ritual impurity in religious texts.
Refers to the singular God, often capitalized in English translations.
Commonly used in religious contexts for making sacred promises.
More formal or literary; implies continuous preservation.

verses.text: 基督已進到天上，在 神右邊，眾天使、有權勢的、有能力的，都服從了他。

words.note: Refers to the singular God, often capitalized in English translations.
Used to denote 'many' or 'all of' a particular group, often in formal or religious contexts.
Often refers to spiritual or governmental authority in biblical contexts.
Indicates completion or change of state.
